EnhancedContent:
Thank you for your interest in the new Azure SDKs! We release new features, improvements, and bug fixes every month. Subscribe to our [Azure SDK Blog RSS Feed](https://devblogs.microsoft.com/azure-sdk/feed/) to get notified when a new release is available.

You can find links to packages, code, and docs on our [Azure SDK Releases page](https://aka.ms/azsdk/releases).

## Release highlights

### [Azure Batch 1.0.0-beta.5](https://central.sonatype.com/artifact/com.azure/azure-compute-batch/1.0.0-beta.5) for Java

This beta release includes major breaking changes with significant model renaming for clarity and consistency. All models with `-Content` suffixes have been renamed to `-Parameters` , and several core classes have been updated to follow Azure SDK naming conventions. The SDK has also introduced Long-Running Operation (LRO) support for extended operations like `beginDeleteJob` , `beginDeallocateNode` , and `beginStopPoolResize` .

### [Azure Identity 1.18.0](https://central.sonatype.com/artifact/com.azure/azure-identity/1.18.0) for Java

Added claims challenge support to `AzureDeveloperCliCredential` , enhanced error handling for `AzurePowerShellCredential` and `AzureCliCredential` , and introduced a new `requireEnvVars()` method to enforce environment variable presence at build time. This release also includes fixes for XML header parsing issues and hanging timeout scenarios.

### [Azure Playwright 1.0.0](https://www.nuget.org/packages/Azure.Developer.Playwright/1.0.0) Initial Stable Release

The first stable release of Azure Playwright Testing SDK is now available for .NET and JavaScript, providing a comprehensive solution for browser automation testing in Azure environments. Management libraries for Playwright are also available across multiple languages (.NET, Go, Java, JavaScript, Python).

### Initial stable releases

- **Client Libraries for .NET**
- [Playwright 1.0.0](https://www.nuget.org/packages/Azure.Developer.Playwright/1.0.0)
- [Playwright NUnit 1.0.0](https://www.nuget.org/packages/Azure.Developer.Playwright.NUnit/1.0.0)
- **Client Library for JavaScript**
- [Playwright 1.0.0](https://www.npmjs.com/package/@azure/playwright/v/1.0.0)
- [Create Playwright 1.0.0](https://www.npmjs.com/package/@azure/create-playwright/v/1.0.0)
- **Management Libraries for .NET**
- [Resource Management – Playwright 1.0.0](https://www.nuget.org/packages/Azure.ResourceManager.Playwright/1.0.0)
- [Resource Management – Fabric 1.0.0](https://www.nuget.org/packages/Azure.ResourceManager.Fabric/1.0.0)
- [Resource Management – Workload Orchestration 1.0.0](https://www.nuget.org/packages/Azure.ResourceManager.WorkloadOrchestration/1.0.0)
- **Management Libraries for Go**
- [Resource Management – Playwright 1.0.0](https://pkg.go.dev/github.com/Azure/azure-sdk-for-go/sdk/resourcemanager/playwright/armplaywright@v1.0.0)
- **Management Libraries for Java**
- [Resource Management – Playwright 1.0.0](https://central.sonatype.com/artifact/com.azure/azure-resourcemanager-playwright/1.0.0)
- **Management Libraries for JavaScript**
- [Resource Management – Playwright 1.0.0](https://www.npmjs.com/package/@azure/arm-playwright/v/1.0.0)
- **Management Library for Python**
- [Resource Management – Playwright 1.0.0](https://pypi.org/project/azure-mgmt-playwright/1.0.0/)

- **Management Libraries for Go**

- [Resource Management – Cloud Health 0.1.0](https://pkg.go.dev/github.com/Azure/azure-sdk-for-go/sdk/resourcemanager/cloudhealth/armcloudhealth@v0.1.0)

- **Management Libraries for Java**
- [Resource Management – Compute Recommender 1.0.0-beta.1](https://central.sonatype.com/artifact/com.azure/azure-resourcemanager-computerecommender/1.0.0-beta.1)
- [Resource Management – Azure Stack HCI VM 1.0.0-beta.1](https://central.sonatype.com/artifact/com.azure/azure-resourcemanager-azurestackhci-vm/1.0.0-beta.1)

- [Resource Management – Compute Recommender 1.0.0b1](https://pypi.org/project/azure-mgmt-computerecommender/1.0.0b1/)

Title: Azure SDK Release (September 2025)
Author: Ronnie Geraghty
Description:
Azure SDK releases every month. In this post, you'll find this month's highlights and release notes.

The post [Azure SDK Release (September 2025)](https://devblogs.microsoft.com/azure-sdk/azure-sdk-release-september-2025/) appeared first on [Azure SDK Blog](https://devblogs.microsoft.com/azure-sdk).
